column2: As for that old duckhouse, I'm glad it's smashed, for maybe now Martha will agree to having it taken down.
column3: As for that old duckhouse, I'm glad it's smashed, for maybe now Martha will agree to having it taken down.

column2: She never would before for fear it might come in handy sometime and I've had to whitewash it every spring.
column3: She never would before for fear it might come in handy sometime and I've had to whitewash it every spring.

column2: But you might as well argue with a post as with Martha.
column3: But you might as well argue with a post as with Martha.

column2: She went to town today--I drove her to the station.
column3: She went to town today-I drove her to the station.

column2: And you want to buy my platter.
column3: And you want to buy my platter.

column2: Well, what will you give for it?"
column3: Well, what will you give for it?"

column2: Twenty dollars, said Anne, who was never meant to match business wits with a Copp, or she would not have offered her price at the start.
column3: Twenty dollars, said Anne, who was never meant to match business wits with a Copp, or she would not have offered her price at the start.

column2: Well, I'll see, said Miss Sarah cautiously.
column3: Well, I'll see, said Miss Sarah cautiously.

column2: That platter is mine fortunately, or I'd never dare to sell it when Martha wasn't here.	That platter is mine fortunately, or I'd never dare to sell it when Martha wasn't here.
column3: false

column2: As it is, I daresay she'll raise a fuss.
column3: As it is, I daresay she'll raise a fuss.

column2: Martha's the boss of this establishment I can tell you.
column3: Martha's the boss of this establishment I can tell you.

column2: I'm getting awful tired of living under another woman's thumb.
column3: I'm getting awful tired of living under another woman's thumb.

column2: But come in, come in.
column3: But come in, come in.

column2: You must be real tired and hungry.
column3: You must be real tired and hungry.

column2: I'll do the best I can for you in the way of tea but I warn you not to expect anything but bread and butter and some cowcumbers.
column3: I'll do the best I can for you in the way of tea but I warn you not to expect anything but bread and butter and some cowcumbers.

column2: Martha locked up all the cake and cheese and preserves afore she went.
column3: Martha locked up all the cake and cheese and preserves afore she went.

column2: She always does, because she says I'm too extravagant with them if company comes."
column3: She always does, because she says I'm too extravagant with them if company comes."

column2: The girls were hungry enough to do justice to any fare, and they enjoyed Miss Sarah's excellent bread and butter and "cowcumbers" thoroughly. When the meal was over Miss Sarah said,
column3: The girls were hungry enough to do justice to any fare, and they enjoyed Miss Sarah's excellent bread and butter and "cowcumbers" thoroughly. When the meal was over Miss Sarah said,

column2: I don't know as I mind selling the platter.	I don't know as I mind selling the platter.
column3: true

column2: But it's worth twenty-five dollars.
column3: But it's worth twenty five dollars.

column2: It's a very old platter."
column3: It's a very old platter."

column2: Diana gave Anne's foot a gentle kick under the table, meaning, "Don't agree--she'll let it go for twenty if you hold out." But Anne was not minded to take any chances in regard to that precious platter.
column3: Diana gave Anne's foot a gentle kick under the table, meaning, "Don't agree-she'll let it go for twenty if you hold out." But Anne was not minded to take any chances in regard to that precious platter.

column2: She promptly agreed to give twenty-five and Miss Sarah looked as if she felt sorry she hadn't asked for thirty.
column3: She promptly agreed to give twenty five and Miss Sarah looked as if she felt sorry she hadn't asked for thirty.

column2: Well, I guess you may have it.	Well, I guess you may have it.
column3: true

column2: I want all the money I can scare up just now.
column3: I want all the money I can scare up just now.

column2: The fact is--" Miss Sarah threw up her head importantly, with a proud flush on her thin cheeks--"I'm going to be married--to Luther Wallace.
column3: The fact is-" Miss Sarah threw up her head importantly, with a proud flush on her thin cheeks-"I'm going to be married-to Luther Wallace.

column2: He wanted me twenty years ago.
column3: He wanted me twenty years ago.

column2: I liked him real well but he was poor then and father packed him off.
column3: I liked him real well but he was poor then and father packed him off.

column2: I s'pose I shouldn't have let him go so meek but I was timid and frightened of father.
column3: I s'pose I shouldn't have let him go so meek but I was timid and frightened of father.

column2: Besides, I didn't know men were so skurse."
column3: Besides, I didn't know men were so skurse."

column2: When the girls were safely away, Diana driving and Anne holding the coveted platter carefully on her lap, the green, rain-freshened solitudes of the Tory Road were enlivened by ripples of girlish laughter.
column3: When the girls were safely away, Diana driving and Anne holding the coveted platter carefully on her lap, the green, rain freshened solitudes of the Tory Road were enlivened by ripples of girlish laughter.

column2: I'll amuse your Aunt Josephine with the 'strange eventful history' of this afternoon when I go to town tomorrow.	I'll amuse your Aunt Josephine with the 'strange eventful history' of this afternoon when I go to town tomorrow.
column3: true

column2: We've had a rather trying time but it's over now.
column3: We've had a rather trying time but it's over now.

column2: I've got the platter, and that rain has laid the dust beautifully.
column3: I've got the platter, and that rain has laid the dust beautifully.

column2: So 'all's well that ends well.'"
column3: So 'all's well that ends well.'"

column2: We're not home yet, said Diana rather pessimistically, "and there's no telling what may happen before we are.
column3: We're not home yet, said Diana rather pessimistically, "and there's no telling what may happen before we are.

column2: You're such a girl to have adventures, Anne."
column3: You're such a girl to have adventures, Anne."
